column4: Hi, does anyone know if VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 82830 CGC is good enough for the desktop effects feature on Ubuntu 7.04?
is that built in to the motherboard?
I'm using an hp laptop...I'm guessing yes.
what's the model # of the laptop?
Pavilion N5495
I had a link of its particulars somewhere, I can dig it up
what video driver are you using for X? vesa?
don't know
grep Driver /etc/X11/xorg.conf
Driver          "kbd"
okay, looks like you're using the right driver....
Ah, I see.  So do you think I can run the desktop effects feature?
hrm, looks like you might not want to use that.. it's only a 1ghz proc?
yup
I just turned it on actually...but not the cube feature
yeah, i wouldn't bother. how much video memory does the card use?
I was just about to thank you for holding my hand while I turned it on, hahaha.  Do you think I should turn this off?
give it a go and see how good/bad it works and decide for yourself :)
is there a command like htop to show me how much of the video card I'm using?
nafaik..
but lspci -v -v -v  should cast a bit of light, also look at /var/log/Xorg.0.log

thanks for the suggestions.  With this laptop the desktop effects work well enough, but it just slows down a little when you scroll up or down windows.  I'll do without, but it's a good tech preview as the feature claims.
